intro: Ecua moluccensis, commonly known as the Moluccan ecua, is a tropical plant native to the Maluku Islands in Indonesia. It is a member of the Araliaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces berries that are orange-red when mature. Ecua moluccensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
